cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles W of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, then northward through the north-western Caribbean into the Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast of the United States.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward across Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–43 kt) are possible Sunday; probability of 50-kt winds is low (≈7%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance indicates 3–5 ft storm surge is possible along the southeast Louisiana coast, including areas near Lake Borgne.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain bands may produce 2–4 inches, with locally higher totals, late Saturday night through Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents expected ahead of the system.
